title: Champs that are heavily dependent on team play
body:
Have noticed that with some champs I absolutely chunk and with others I can chunk only if the team is on board and if not on board then I suck.

Struggle to make a difference with champs that take me balls deep into the other team or who have no escapes once in the team fight. Udyr / xin / mumu etc. Without the backup of the team they're a bit useless. They can break another team if your team is on board, but if your team off the bus then they are a bit useless.

replies.body: Play someone who can shift into support for the mid/jungle carry and never lose again(i lie)

I am half decent with vi and diana jg. even though vi has an all in with her R she can always Q over a wall or two to get out if the team dont have your back. Was just a comment that some champs have kits that take them balls deep and without team synergy, you're balls deep.
The majority of times the team never has your back lol
oh but when they do it is sweet beautiful music.

silver. What is your contribution to the discussion other than to incorrectly point out my rank?
Oh, sorry if it wasn't clear, your elo is relevant to the discussion because your game knowledge is love.

And once again that's stupid.
Its a discussion of X VS Y champions.
Even bronze people have basic game knowledge of "Oh this is a 1 v 1 type champion"
or "This champion requires additional support in order to do things"

Its a discussion on "Hey have you guys noticed that master Yi is really good 1 v 1.
And if his team helps him out he can wipe out the enemy team?
Or Supports are really bad by themselves, Braum and sona have no DMG but can help there team completely wipe an opposing team"

---

If your not gonna sit here and actually use the boards for what they are suppose to be used for.
Then dont go around going "Lel your bronze you have no opinion"

but I'm silver....

Yeah I know.
Some people are bronze because they derp and dont understand things.
But in this discussion and even some others, why bring up elo it has nothing to do with it.
wait are you agreeing with me? Not clear to me?

meh - I've been around long enough not to get upset at comments like yathat. He's now in the same bucket as CJ and Lajneen, the other OCE boards winners.

found this the other day

http://genericdiscussion.freeforums.net/thread/25111/share-important-piece-oce-history?page=1
Yeah I found some of the old forum GD posts and shit too.

from my experience at a low diamond level, udyr doesn't need a team to help him, he is unkillable 1v3 and can always just run away, xin much the same just bit squishy and 10x damage. Many times i've seen a xin go in 1v3 kill an immobile high priority target and win the teamfight by suiciding for it. 

udyr/xin can solo carry teamfights without a team behind them.

Pro tip:
Dont chase, and just stick with your team.

If any team is any good they can peel for there carries to stop a Xin or Udry 1 v 5ing them.
a decent udyr wont die lol

Essembie you cunny funt :)
I thank you.

>Udyr

Udyr doesn't need any help from his team, you just have to mash bear and turtle when you need to run (and not get hit by skillshots)

You can even just get the AP pot later in the game, and use your Q (even as pheonix udyr) with your W and you will not only tank a tower by yourself, but also take it.

I can farm like a mofo with him but unless my team mates have initiated engage before I get there and if the lane is warded, then the gank invariably fails for me :(

I find that with folks like Vi for whom I can close the gap VERY easily (over walls too) and get a guaranteed CC on the target the ganks are a lot more successful. But with Ud the only gap closer apart from flash is his move speed and if the lane is warded the target has to be a potato to get hit.

Udyr, Gank?

But yes knowing your champions capabilities is part of it, basically you can't gank a warded lane like that (you have to find an alternate path or sweep it) therefore you have to find a lane you can gank.

That said given your Elo, there should be plenty of times where you can just run straight into a lane (don't hesitate) and actually catch them off guard (silver players don't spend all that much time looking at their map, use that to your advantage)

A special thing you can do, if you know it's warded (and where) sweep the ward, but ignore it and keep running in, this gets you a surprise gank, because they lose their vision without realizing they have (this works even better post 9 with the upgraded sweeper).

Sure some champs may require a little more assistance from the team, but in the end you have to work with your team just as much as they work with you. A decision to go HAM that you see as a perfect game winning engage may be seen as a throw by others. Try communicating your plan through chat may help, "I'm going to split push don't fight" or " If I catch their adc out of position I'm going in".
A basic check of ally summs and tracking the enemies is one of the most vital pieces of information before making such decisions. If you're team does not have all ults, your adc is missing flash etc means just play a little more passive until they are up.
